problem.p: A uniform solid sphere of mass \(m\) and radius \(r\) is given, by a quick push, a horizontal speed \(v_0\) along a horizontal surface. Due to the friction between the surface and the sphere, the latter eventually begins to roll without slipping.
What is the best description of the motion of the sphere before slipping ends?

choice.name: foil1
choice.p: The translational speed increases while rotational speed increases

choice.name: foil2
choice.p: The translational speed decreases while rotational speed increases

choice.name: foil3
choice.p: The translational speed increases while rotational speed decreases

choice.name: foil4
choice.p: The translational speed decreases while rotational speed decreases

problem.p: Find the speed \(v\) of the sphere after slipping stops.

Find the amount of heat \(Q\) generated before the slipping of the sphere stops. Note: the "amount of heat" can be found as the difference between the initial and the final kinetic energy of the sphere.
